info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 2:20AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE FREEZING RAIN WITH A LITTLE SLEET WILL MOVE ACROSS PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON, SOUTHERN COLLETON AND SOUTHERN BERKELEY COUNTIES... An area of light to moderate freezing rain will move northeast across much of Charleston, southern Colleton and southern Berkeley Counties through 4 AM. The freezing rain may occasionally mix with sleet. Additional ice accumulations of a few hundredths to as much as a tenth of an inch can be expected. Travel may become hazardous, especially across the bridges and overpasses across the Charleston Metro Area.
info.instruction: If you plan to drive or walk, remain alert for slick spots on paved surfaces. Slow your driving speed and use care when walking on sidewalks, driveways or parking lots. Slips and falls constitute a leading cause of injuries during winter weather.
